Hello,

I have same question with Kaisa.

I am able to correctly run Heritrix. Now I expect to
index/random_read created ARC files. After
reading/searching for a while, I am still not able to
get any program to do this job.

So the question might be silly, but I really want to
know where and if I can get these tools. And if not,
is  it part of future work of Heritrix?

thanks a lot,
xiaoming







--- kaisa_kaunonen <kaisa.kaunonen@...> wrote:
> Hi, 
> 
> I collected a nice test archive of about 100000 docs
> with 
> heritrix 0.6.0
> I think it went well (I didn't yet try out very
> baaad web sites;)
>  
> Now I try to index the archive with nwatoolset. 
> At this point it seems that cdx files are needed.
> How do I generate them? 
>  
> I went to 
>
http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/io/arc/ARCWriter.html
> which shows a procedure 
> % av_procarc *.arc.gz | av_ziparc > * .dat.gz 
> % av_ripdat *.dat.gz > *.cdx
>  
> Nearby is a link called 'alexa ARC c-tools' which
> points to
>
http://www.archive.org/web/researcher/tool_documentation.php
>  
> It mentions av_procarc and av_ziparc and gives their
> usage
> but doesn't tell where I could fetch those scripts
> (perl, shell?)
> It doesn't mention av_ripdat.
>  
> av_remdt looks quite promising too, does this script
> exist?
>  
> ?kaisa?
> 
> 
> 
>  
> Yahoo! Groups Links

> 
>
